header.title: Schools ‘intimidated’ into dropping LGBT inclusive relationship lessons
header.postText: More than 70 schools are facing ‘pressure and intimidation’ as protests against LGBT relationship lessons are ‘growing across the country’, a Labour MP has warned.', 'Emma Hardy said misinformation over relationship education is ‘vast and in danger of spreading’ and accused the government for not doing enough to prevent it.', 'It comes after last night’s BBC Panorama documentary suggested the Department for Education pressured Parkfield Community School in Birmingham to suspend its equality programme to avoid media attention.', 'Asking an urgent question in the House of Commons, Ms Hardy said: ‘Over 70 schools are now seeing pressure and intimidation because of school leaders fulfilling their legal duty under the Equality Act.', '‘It is clear from last night’s Panorama programme that protests against relationship education are growing across the country’.', 'Minister for school standards Nick Gibb said he and Education Secretary Damian Hinds ‘strongly encourage primary schools to teach LGBT relationships’.', 'He added: ‘Parents have a right to understand what we are requiring schools to teach and how their child’s school is intending to go about it.', '‘That’s why we will be requiring schools to consult parents on their relationships education or RSE policy, but open and constructive dialogue can only work if the facts of the situation are known to all.', '‘We are aware that misinformation is circulating about what schools currently teach about relationships and what they will teach when the new subjects are introduced.’', 'Ms Hardy said there was a ‘desperate need for clear, firm leadership from the department’.', 'She added: ‘It would also appear from last night’s Panorama programme that pressure was applied from the Department for Education to Parkfield School to suspend their equality programme to get the school out of the national news.', '‘This has led to copycat protests elsewhere as protesters believe that if they make enough noise and turn up the loudhailers and hurl abuse at head teachers that other schools will back down too.’', 'She asked if Mr Gibb would update guidance to schools to ensure they have a clear message about the need to teach LGBT-inclusive sex and relationship education – which is mandated by the government and checked by Ofsted.', 'Mr Gibb did not accept the department was too slow to respond to protests outside Parkfield School, which went on for several months.', 'He added: ‘We’ve been working very closely with senior officials, working very closely with the school.', '‘We do want to achieve maximum consensus with this relationship education, that’s why there’s a requirement to publish the policy on the school’s website, that’s in regulations and to consult parents, it’s in the statutory guidance.', '‘But ultimately it is a matter for the school itself to decide on the curriculum, and when the school has decided on what it wants to teach and when, it will (have) the full support and backing of the DfE and from ministers.’', 'Shadow education secretary and Angela Rayner said the guidance needed to go further.', 'She told MPs: ‘I do not believe that the issues that are coming up is about consultation.', '‘It’s about LGBT and misinformation that has been given out and the bigotry that is being displayed by some minorities on our streets. We have to hit back.’', 'Labour MP for Birmingham Yardley Jess Philips said: ‘If the minister thinks that the guidance is right he maybe wants to come and live where I live.', '‘What we are up against here is racists and homophobes who are trying to put what they think on the children where I live.’', 'Mr Gibb responded: ‘She says if we had only changed the wording of the guidance to make it more of a requirement – I don’t believe that would have prevented the protest that she is seeing at the Birmingham schools.', '‘Because there is a segment of opinion at either end of this debate that will not be persuaded of the appropriateness of this guidance.’
